title: Why do fingers become pruney? - Mark Changizi

multiple-choice.question: What observation made in the 1930s led scientists to explore the idea that pruney fingers might have an adaptive function?

options.label: A
options.text: Patients with nerve damage to their hands had slower reaction times.

options.label: B
options.text: Patients with nerve damage to their hands did not get pruney fingertips in a bath.

options.label: C
options.text: Patients with nerve damage to their hands had more sensitive fingertips.

options.label: D
options.text: Patients with nerve damage to their hands had stronger grips.

multiple-choice.question: What is the proposed function of the wrinkles on pruney fingers?

options.label: A
options.text: To increase the surface area of the fingers for better grip in dry conditions.

options.label: B
options.text: To channel out water and improve grip in wet conditions, similar to rain treads on car tires.

options.label: C
options.text: To reduce the sensitivity of the fingers in cold conditions.

options.label: D
options.text: To increase the flexibility of the fingers in hot conditions.

multiple-choice.question: What is the typical shape of river networks in concave basins?

options.label: A
options.text: Smaller river channels joining to make larger river channels downstream.

options.label: B
options.text: Larger river channels diverging away from one another downstream.

options.label: C
options.text: River channels forming a tree-like network with the trunk uphill.

options.label: D
options.text: River channels forming a circular network with no clear direction.

multiple-choice.question: What is the expected shape of the wrinkle patterns on pruney fingers if they are designed to channel out water?

options.label: A
options.text: A tree network of divides with the trunk near the tip of the finger.

options.label: B
options.text: A circular network of channels with no clear direction.

options.label: C
options.text: A series of parallel channels running along the length of the finger.

options.label: D
options.text: A random pattern of wrinkles with no clear structure.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of new behavioral experiments on the effect of pruney fingers on grip in wet conditions?

options.label: A
options.text: Pruney fingers have no significant effect on grip in wet conditions.

options.label: B
options.text: Pruney fingers significantly improve grip in wet conditions.

options.label: C
options.text: Pruney fingers significantly worsen grip in wet conditions.

multiple-choice.question: What task were subjects asked to perform in the behavioral experiments on pruney fingers?

options.label: A
options.text: Grasping dry marbles and moving them through a hole.

options.label: B
options.text: Grasping wet marbles and moving them through a hole.

options.label: C
options.text: Grasping a wet bar and holding on for a certain amount of time.

options.label: D
options.text: Grasping a dry bar and holding on for a certain amount of time.

multiple-choice.question: Why might primates have evolved pruney fingers?

options.label: A
options.text: To deal with the dry, grip-light conditions of the savannah.

options.label: B
options.text: To deal with the wet, grip-heavy conditions of the forest.

options.label: C
options.text: To improve their ability to climb trees.

options.label: D
options.text: To improve their ability to run long distances.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea of the passage?

options.label: A
options.text: The mysteries of the natural world are impossible to solve.

options.label: B
options.text: The shape of river networks can be used to understand the function of pruney fingers.

options.label: C
options.text: The function of pruney fingers is to improve grip in dry conditions.

options.label: D
options.text: By observing similarities between seemingly unrelated things, we can come up with ideas about their function.

multiple-choice.question: What is the shape of river networks on convex promontories?

options.label: A
options.text: Smaller river channels joining to make larger river channels downstream.

options.label: B
options.text: Larger river channels diverging away from one another downstream.

options.label: C
options.text: River channels forming a tree-like network with the trunk uphill.

options.label: D
options.text: River channels forming a circular network with no clear direction.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of comparing the shape of river networks on convex promontories to the wrinkle patterns on pruney fingers?

options.label: B
options.text: They have similar shapes, but with some key differences.

options.label: C
options.text: They have identical shapes, with a tree-like network of divides.

title: Pros and cons of public opinion polls - Jason Robert Jaffe
